title.text: Northeastern University Shares Our Cofounders’ Story

richText.text: Following their first-place award in the Women Who Empower Initiative in 2021, cofounders Emily Man and Valeria Martinuzzi were invited to share their story with Northeastern University’s News@Northeastern.

title.text: Venova Technologies' Cofounders Win Northeastern’s Women Who Empower Award

richText.text: Northeastern University's College of Engineering recognized Venova Technologies' cofounders, Emily Man and Valeria Martinuzzi, who graduated from the graduate Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering program in 2019.

title.text: Venova Technologies’ Cofounders Receive First Place in Inaugural Women Who Empower Competition by Northeastern University and Cartier Foundation

richText.text: We are excited to announce that two of the cofounders, Emily Man and Valeria Martinuzzi, at Venova Technologies were recognized in the inaugural cohort of Women Who Empower, an initiative hosted and funded by their alma mater, Northeastern University, and Cartier Foundation. This award recognizes female entrepreneurs in the Northeastern University ecosystem. Emily and Val placed first for their category and received $10,000.
